Question.Text: A 41-Year-Old Male Traveller with a 7-day history of itchy skin eruptions on both upper thighs. He has recently returned from a trip to Asia and Australia.

Answer: Cutaneous larva migrans (creeping eruption) - The traveler presents with intensely itchy serpiginous skin eruptions on thighs after returning from Asia and Australia. The images show characteristic raised, erythematous, serpiginous (snake-like) tracks on skin and hookworm larvae. This condition results from cutaneous penetration and migration of animal hookworm larvae (typically dog/cat Ancylostoma species) acquired from contaminated sandy beaches or soil.
